name: airflow-vscode-extension
description: Apache Airflow Extension to List/Trigger DAGs, View Logs and much more

chatParticipants.name: airflow
chatParticipants.description: Your AI Airflow Assistant. I can help you manage your DAGs, view logs, and perform various operations on your Apache Airflow environment.

languageModelTools.name: trigger_dag_run
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Triggers a specific Apache Airflow DAG run via the REST API. Use this tool when the user wants to execute or start a DAG workflow. Required inputs: dag_id (string) - the unique identifier of the DAG to trigger, config_json (string) - a JSON string containing the DAG run configuration parameters (e.g., {"param1": "value1"}). This is a state-changing operation that requires user confirmation.

dagId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the DAG to trigger

configJson.description: JSON string containing configuration parameters OR an absolute file path to a JSON file.

date.description: The logical date (execution date) for the DAG run in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2023-12-01T10:00:00Z'). Optional.

languageModelTools.name: get_failed_runs
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieves a summary list of DAG runs that have failed (status: failed, upstream_failed, or skipped) within a specified time range using the Airflow batch API. Use this tool for monitoring and observability to help users identify problems. Optional inputs: time_range_hours (integer, defaults to 24) - how many hours back to search, dag_id_filter (string, optional) - filter results to a specific DAG ID. Returns a JSON array of failed run objects.

timeRangeHours.description: Number of hours to look back for failed runs (default: 24)

dagIdFilter.description: Optional: Filter by specific DAG ID

languageModelTools.name: list_active_dags
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Lists all Airflow DAGs that are currently active (not paused). Use this tool when the user asks to see enabled or active DAGs. Returns a list of DAG IDs and their details.

languageModelTools.name: list_paused_dags
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Lists all Airflow DAGs that are currently paused. Use this tool when the user asks to see disabled or stopped DAGs. Returns a list of DAG IDs and their details.

languageModelTools.name: get_running_dags
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Lists all Airflow DAGs that currently have running or queued DAG runs. Use this tool when the user asks to see which DAGs are currently executing, running or in progress. Returns a list of DAG IDs with their run states and run IDs.

languageModelTools.name: pause_dag
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Pauses a specific Airflow DAG. This stops new runs from being scheduled. Use this tool when the user wants to stop, disable, or pause a DAG. Required input: dag_id (string). This is a state-changing operation that requires user confirmation.

dagId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the DAG to pause

languageModelTools.name: unpause_dag
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Unpauses (activates) a specific Airflow DAG. This allows new runs to be scheduled. Use this tool when the user wants to start, enable, or unpause a DAG. Required input: dag_id (string). This is a state-changing operation that requires user confirmation.

dagId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the DAG to unpause

languageModelTools.name: get_dag_runs
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieves the run history for a specific Airflow DAG. Returns run ID, start time, duration, and status (success, failed, running, etc.) for each run. Optional input: date (string in YYYY-MM-DD format, defaults to today). Use this tool when the user wants to see the execution history or status of DAG runs.

dagId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the DAG to query

date.description: Optional: Date to filter runs (YYYY-MM-DD format, defaults to today)

languageModelTools.name: cancel_dag_run
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Cancels the currently running DAG run for a specific Airflow DAG. Use this tool when the user wants to cancel, stop, or terminate a running DAG execution. The DAG run will be marked as failed and cancelled. Required input: dag_id (string). This is a state-changing operation that requires user confirmation.

dagId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the DAG whose run should be cancelled

languageModelTools.name: analyse_dag_latest_run
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Performs a comprehensive analysis of the latest DAG run. Retrieves and analyzes: DAG run details, all task instances with their states, DAG source code, and task logs (focusing on failed tasks). Use this tool when the user wants a complete diagnostic report of a DAG execution, understand what went wrong, or get a detailed analysis of task execution. Required input: dag_id (string). This provides the most comprehensive diagnostic information.

dagId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the DAG to analyze

languageModelTools.name: get_dag_history
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieves the run history for a specific DAG on a given date. Returns a list of runs with their date/time, status, duration, and any notes. Optional input: date (string in YYYY-MM-DD format, defaults to today). Use this tool when the user wants to see the execution history for a specific day or review past runs.

dagId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the DAG to query

date.description: Optional: Date to filter runs (YYYY-MM-DD format, defaults to today)

languageModelTools.name: get_dag_run_detail
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Performs a comprehensive analysis of a specific DAG run identified by its run ID. Retrieves and analyzes: DAG run details, all task instances with their states, DAG source code, and task logs (focusing on failed tasks). Use this tool when the user wants a complete diagnostic report of a specific DAG run execution, understand what went wrong in a particular run, or get detailed analysis of a specific run. Required inputs: dag_id (string), dag_run_id (string). This provides comprehensive diagnostic information for a specific run.

dagId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the DAG

dagRunId.description: The unique identifier of the DAG run to analyze

languageModelTools.name: get_today
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Returns the current system date in multiple formats. Use this tool when the user asks for today's date, current date, or what day it is. Helpful for date-based filtering operations. No inputs required. Returns the date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD), full format, and day of week.

languageModelTools.name: get_dag_source_code
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieves the Python source code for a specific Airflow DAG. Use this tool when the user wants to see, analyze, or review the DAG's implementation code. Useful for understanding DAG structure, task dependencies, configurations, and logic. Required input: dag_id (string). Returns the complete Python source code of the DAG file.

dagId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the DAG to get source code for

languageModelTools.name: go_to_dag_view
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Opens the DAG View panel in VS Code to display information about a specific Airflow DAG. Use this tool when the user wants to see, view, or open a DAG in the visual panel. Required input: dag_id (string). Optional input: dag_run_id (string) - if provided, navigates to that specific DAG run instead of the latest run. This is a navigation tool that does not modify any state.

dagId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the DAG to view

dagRunId.description: Optional: The DAG run ID to navigate to. If not provided, shows the latest run.

languageModelTools.name: go_to_dag_log_view
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Opens the DAG Log View panel in VS Code to display task logs for a specific Airflow DAG. Use this tool when the user wants to see the logs for tasks in a DAG run. Required input: dag_id (string). Optional inputs: dag_run_id (string), task_id (string), try_number (number). If task_id and try_number are provided, it focuses on that specific log. This is a navigation tool.

dagId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the DAG

taskId.description: Optional: The Task ID to filter logs for

tryNumber.description: Optional: The try number of the task instance

languageModelTools.name: go_to_dag_run_history
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Opens the DAG Run History panel in VS Code to display run history for a specific Airflow DAG. Use this tool when the user wants to see run history, execution logs, or past runs for a DAG. Required input: dag_id (string). Optional inputs: start_date (string in YYYY-MM-DD format), end_date (string in YYYY-MM-DD format), status (string: success, failed, running, queued, upstream_failed). This is a navigation tool that does not modify any state.

dagId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the DAG to view history for

startDate.description: Optional: Start date for the filter in YYYY-MM-DD format

endDate.description: Optional: End date for the filter in YYYY-MM-DD format

status.description: Optional: Filter by run status (success, failed, running, queued, upstream_failed)

languageModelTools.name: go_to_providers_view
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Opens the Providers View panel to display installed Airflow providers with their versions and descriptions. Use this tool when the user wants to see what providers are installed in Airflow. No inputs required. This is a navigation tool that does not modify any state.

languageModelTools.name: go_to_connections_view
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Opens the Connections View panel to display Airflow connections (databases, APIs, cloud services, etc.). Use this tool when the user wants to see configured connections in Airflow. No inputs required. This is a navigation tool that does not modify any state.

languageModelTools.name: go_to_variables_view
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Opens the Variables View panel to display Airflow variables (key-value configuration settings). Use this tool when the user wants to see configured variables in Airflow. No inputs required. This is a navigation tool that does not modify any state.

languageModelTools.name: go_to_configs_view
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Opens the Configs View panel to display Airflow configuration settings (airflow.cfg). Use this tool when the user wants to see the Airflow configuration. No inputs required. This is a navigation tool that does not modify any state.

languageModelTools.name: go_to_plugins_view
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Opens the Plugins View panel to display installed Airflow plugins. Use this tool when the user wants to see what plugins are installed in Airflow. No inputs required. This is a navigation tool that does not modify any state.

languageModelTools.name: go_to_server_health_view
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Opens the Server Health View panel to display Airflow server health status, including scheduler status and metadata database status. Use this tool when the user wants to check the health or status of the Airflow server. No inputs required. This is a navigation tool that does not modify any state.

viewsWelcome.contents:
To connect to Airflow Click Below 
 [Connect to Airflow](command:dagTreeView.addServer)

 You should enable REST Api in the Airflow to connect.
 For now, only basic authentication (username/password) supported.
 [Learn More](https://github.com/necatiarslan/airflow-vscode-extension/blob/main/README.md) 

 Click [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZeWDVPNDXZg) on how to run Airflow in your local machine in 5 mins.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
